Activity2.Description: CAMPING/CHILDCARE THE BANGOR Y STRIVES TO PROVIDE HIGH-QUALITY CHILDCARE PROGRAMS IN A SAFE, NURTURING ENVIRONMENT THAT ENCOURAGE ACADEMIC, PHYSICAL AND SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT FOR PRE-SCHOOL AND SCHOOL-AGED CHILDREN IN THE GREATER BANGOR COMMUNITY. BANGOR Y CHILDCARE PROGRAMS OFFER BOTH FULL AND PART-TIME OPPORTUNITIES AND INCLUDE ENRICHING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS SWIM AND GYM, ARTS & CRAFTS, HOMEWORK TIME AND CHOICE ACTIVITIES WHICH MAY INCLUDE MUSIC, WELLNESS AND GAMES THAT BUILD FRIENDSHIPS, PROMOTE CREATIVITY AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY, AND ALLOW CHILDREN TO HAVE FUN. (CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O) LIKE ALL BANGOR Y PROGRAMS, OUR CHILDCARE PROGRAMS REINFORCE THE CHARACTER VALUES OF HONESTY, CARING, RESPECT AND RESPONSIBILITY. WE PARTNER WITH OTHER COMMUNITY AND GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, INCLUDING THE UNITED WAY AND DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES TO HELP ENSURE THAT OUR CHILDCARE PROGRAMS ARE ACCESSIBLE TO ALL AND FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS AVAILABLE FOR THOSE IN NEED. IN 2009, WE SERVED 431 CHILDREN IN OUR BANGOR Y CHILDCARE PROGRAMS AND PROVIDED MORE THAN 32,000 IN FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. FOR MORE THAN 100 YEARS, THE BANGOR Y HAS BEEN PROVIDING SAFE, QUALITY CAMPING EXPERIENCES THAT ENCOURAGE SELF-DISCOVERY, CHARACTER-BUILDING, AND FUN FOR YOUNG PEOPLE IN THE GREATER BANGOR COMMUNITY AND BEYOND. THE BANGOR Y OFFERS A VARIETY OF SUMMER DAY CAMPS FOR CHILDREN AGES 5-12, WITH A LEADERS-IN-TRAINING PROGRAM FOR YOUTH IN THE 8TH-10TH GRADES. THE BANGOR Y 200-ACRE RESIDENT CAMP, CAMP JORDAN, IS THE OLDEST YMCA CAMP IN MAINE AND WELCOMES CHILDREN AGES 8-14 EACH SUMMER. CAMP JORDAN ALSO HOSTS A POPULAR LEADERS SCHOOL PROGRAM FOR 2 WEEKS EACH SUMMER WHERE TEENS ARE ENCOURAGED TO BUILD SKILLS, SELF-ESTEEM AND SHAPE FUTURE GOALS THROUGH ADVENTURE CHALLENGE AND PERSONAL REFLECTION. BANGOR Y CAMPERS ENJOY A MIX OF TRADITIONAL AND NON-TRADITIONAL PROGRAMMING INCLUDING CANOEING, SWIMMING, SAILING, ARCHERY, FISHING, CRAFTS, THEATER, ROPES COURSE, NATURE EDUCATION, HIKING, SPORTS, AND MOVIE-MAKING. ALL BANGOR Y SUMMER CAMPS BENEFIT FROM WELL-TRAINED AND EXPERIENCED STAFF, MANY OF WHOM ALSO WORK IN OUR BANGOR Y CHILDCARE PROGRAMS AND RETURN AS SUMMER CAMP STAFF EACH YEAR. TO MAKE BANGOR Y SUMMER CAMPS ACCESSIBLE TO ALL, WE OFFER ACCESS-Y SUMMER CAMP SCHOLARSHIPS AND A SEND-A-KID-TO-CAMP PROGRAM TO HELP THOSE IN NEED OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. IN 2009, BANGOR Y SUMMER CAMPS SERVED 1,273 CHILDREN AND PROVIDED MORE THAN 37,000 IN FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.

Activity3.Description: OUTREACH AND EDUCATION/COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS AS PART OF OUR MISSION, THE BANGOR Y IS COMMITTED TO BUILDING STRONG KIDS, STRONG FAMILIES, AND STRONG COMMUNITIES THROUGH OUTREACH AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS AND COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS THAT HELP CHILDREN, ADULTS, SENIORS AND FAMILIES MOST IN NEED. (CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O) BANGOR Y YOUTH AND TEEN PROGRAMS REACH OUT TO AT-RISK YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES BY PROVIDING SUPPORT AND SKILL DEVELOPMENT IN THOSE AREAS MOST CRITICAL FOR AT-RISK YOUTH: INSTRUCTION IN NUTRITION, LIFE SKILLS, COMMUNICATION AND RELATIONSHIP SKILLS, DECISION MAKING SKILLS AND SUBSTANCE USE RESISTANCE SKILLS; MENTORING OPPORTUNITIES, EMPHASIS ON BUILDING CONFIDENCE AND SELF-ESTEEM; IDENTIFICATION OF AND STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS PEER TO PEER ABUSE/BULLYING; AND ACADEMIC SUPPORT AND HELP WITH SCHOOL-RELATED ISSUES. THE PROGRAMS ALSO INCLUDE A COMMUNITY SERVICE COMPONENT TO ENCOURAGE YOUTH TO DEVELOP A CONNECTION AND SENSE OF RESPONSIBILITY TO THEIR COMMUNITY. OUR GOAL IS TO INVOLVE AT-RISK YOUTH IN OUR COMMUNITY IN CHARACTER BUILDING PROGRAMS THAT WILL NOT ONLY HELP THEM TO COPE WITH DIFFICULT SITUATIONS AND MAKE BETTER LIFE CHOICES, BUT PROVIDE THEM WITH LEADERSHIP SKILLS AS WELL. THE BANGOR Y CARING CONNECTIONS PROGRAM OFFERED IN PARTNERSHIP WITH EASTERN MAINE MEDICAL CENTER PROVIDES WOMEN'S HEALTH EDUCATION AND SERVICES AND SUPPORT FOR WOMEN DIAGNOSED WITH BREAST CANCER AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE BANGOR Y CARDIAC/PULMONARY REHABILITATION PROGRAM OFFERED WITH THE SUPPORT OF VOLUNTEERS FROM ST. JOSEPH HOSPITAL PROVIDES EDUCATION, SUPPORT AND APPROPRIATE, PROGRESSIVE, SUPERVISED PHYSICAL ACTIVITY FOR THOSE SUFFERING FROM CHRONIC CARDIAC OR PULMONARY DISEASE OR WHO HAVE SUFFERED CARDIAC OR PULMONARY EVENTS. IN 2009, THE BANGOR Y TOUCHED MORE THAN 3,000 INDIVIDUALS THROUGH OUR COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS.

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE BANGOR Y IS A COMMUNITY LEADER IN SUPPORTING CHILDREN, ADULTS AND FAMILIES IN THEIR LIFELONG QUEST FOR PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL AND SOCIAL WELLNESS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE BANGOR Y IS A COMMUNITY LEADER IN SUPPORTING CHILDREN, ADULTS AND FAMILIES IN THEIR LIFELONG QUEST FOR PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL AND SOCIAL WELLNESS.
IRS990.Description: HEALTH AND WELL BEING FOR ALL THE BANGOR Y IS A COMMUNITY LEADER IN SUPPORTING CHILDREN, ADULTS AND FAMILIES IN THEIR LIFELONG QUEST FOR PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL, AND SOCIAL WELLNESS. A FAMILY ORGANIZATION, THE BANGOR Y EMPHASIZES THE IMPORTANCE OF A HEALTHY LIFESTYLE AND IS RECOGNIZED AS A LEADER IN PROMOTING HEALTH AND WELLNESS FOR ALL MEMBERS OF OUR GREATER COMMUNITY, FROM OUR CHILDREN TO OUR SENIORS. EACH PROGRAM IS ESTABLISHED TO PROVIDE A GROWTH AND ENRICHMENT OPPORTUNITY IN THE PARTICIPANT'S PHYSICAL, COGNITIVE, SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT WITH AGE-APPROPRIATE LEARNING AND FUN. (CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O) BANGOR Y PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES ENCOURAGE TEAM-BUILDING, LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, SKILL-BUILDING AND CHARACTER VALUES THROUGH SPORTS, AQUATICS AND FITNESS PROGRAMMING WHILE PROVIDING A CARING ENVIRONMENT, NEW OPPORTUNITIES, PHYSICAL ACTIVITY, SUPERVISION BY TRAINED STAFF, AND A PLACE TO BELONG. TO MAKE THE PROGRAMS OF THE BANGOR Y MORE ACCESSIBLE TO THOSE WITH FINANCIAL HARDSHIP WE OFFER THE ACCESS-Y SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM. ACCESS-Y ALLOWS QUALIFYING INDIVIDUALS TO PARTICIPATE WITH EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES IN PROGRAMS AND SERVICES AT NO COST OR FOR A REDUCED FEE. THIS SUPPORT REACHES TO THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY, INCLUDING THOSE WHO ARE MOST OFTEN IN NEED, OUR CHILDREN. IN 2009, WE PROVIDED MEMBERSHIP SCHOLARSHIPS TO 727 PEOPLE IN THE AMOUNT OF 95,719.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART V, LINE 4
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: TO SUPPORT THE BANGOR YMCA OPERATIONS.
THE ORGANIZATIONS FEDERAL RETURN OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX FOR 2010, 2009, AND 2008 ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE IRS, GENERALLY FOR THREE YEARS AFTER THEY WERE FILED.

THE BY-LAWS STATE THAT THE ORGANIZATION IS MADE UP OF MEMBERS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ELECTION OF MEMBERS AND THEIR RIGHTS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: AN ANNUAL MEETING OF THE VOTING MEMBERS OF THE CORPORATION SHALL BE HELD FOR THE PURPOSE OF ELECTING THE DIRECTORS OF THE CORPORATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ORGANIZATION'S PROCESS USED TO REVIEW FORM 990

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE ENFORCED PER THE POLICY.

CURRENTLY IF THERE IS A VACANCY IN A TOP MANAGEMENT POSITION, THE BOARD WOULD NORMALLY CONDUCT AN INFORMAL SURVEY OF THE SALARY PAID TO OTHER OFFICERS WITH SIMILAR RESPONSIBILITIES FROM NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS OF SIMILAR SIZE AND COMPLEXITY. THIS IS DONE TO ESTABLISH A CURRENT SALARY RANGE FOR THE POSITION. INCREASES AFTER HIRE HAVE TRADITIONALLY BEEN DEPENDENT ON A COST OF LIVING ADJUSTMENT PROVIDED FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE.
THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MAINTAINED IN THE OFFICE AND ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC DURING STANDARD BUSINESS HOURS.
